perturbation.original_text:
6.5 Reporting. Distributor will provide IMNTV with a quarterly report or monthly report if available, summarizing the data relevant to the payment obligations
herein within five (5) business days from the end of the calendar quarter. The reports will contain sufficient information to permit Provider to verify payments
hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.5 Reporting. Distributor will provide IMNTV with a quarterly report, summarizing the data relevant to the payment obligations herein within sixty (60) business days from the end of the calendar quarter. The reports will contain only the total revenue received.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the distributor to provide a quarterly report within five business days from the end of the calendar quarter, including sufficient information to allow the provider to verify payments. The modified text extends the reporting deadline to sixty business days and restricts the report to only the total revenue received. This change contradicts standard accounting practices and legal requirements for transparency and timely financial reporting, potentially violating regulations related to financial disclosures and audits, and making verification difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting Standards and Practices, potential violation of audit and transparency regulations.

perturbation.original_text:
9.3 Confidentiality. The parties acknowledge that Confidential Information is valuable and unique and that disclosure in breach of this confidentiality provision will
result in irreparable injury to its owner. From the Effective Date and for a period of two (2) years from the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement,
neither party will use, disclose, or permit any person to obtain any Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.3 Confidentiality. The parties acknowledge that Confidential Information may be valuable. From the Effective Date and until termination or expiration of this Agreement, neither party will use Confidential Information of the other party without explicit written consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets a confidentiality period of two years post-termination, which is a standard practice. The modified text removes the post-termination confidentiality obligation, meaning that after the contract ends, either party is free to disclose confidential information. Moreover, it changes the constraint regarding using such data without consent until termination. This can potentially contradict trade secret laws, which often protect confidential information indefinitely as long as it remains a secret and provides a competitive advantage. Making it usable after termination of the contract can be problematic, especially if the company closes down.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Laws, Contract Law regarding confidentiality obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1 General Termination Rights. Either party may terminate the Agreement at any time in the event of a material breach by the other party that remains uncured
after thirty (30) days written notice of the breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 General Termination Rights. Either party may terminate the Agreement at any time, with no prior warning or notice, for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows termination for a material breach only after a 30-day written notice and failure to cure the breach. The modified text allows termination at any time, for any reason, without any notice. This contradicts fundamental principles of contract law, particularly the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing, and could be deemed unconscionable depending on jurisdiction. The deletion of a time constraint, such as a deadline, introduces legal issues.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Unconscionability.
